definition:
On any triangle, the three lines obtained by reflecting the medians in
the (internal) angle bisectors are called the *symmedians* of the
triangle.

![image](symmed)

In the picture, $BX$ is angle bisector and $BM$ a median. The reflection
of $BM$ on $BX$ is $BN$, a symmedian.

It can be stated as symmedians are isogonal conjugates of medians.
